arm_group.description: Practices participating in state immunization registry invited to reminder/recall (R/R) webinar trainings and provided educational materials to encourage immunization within their practices
Collaborative centralized reminder/recall (R/R) effort will be conducted by state immunization registry in collaboration with accountable care organizations and practices

brief_summary.textblock:
This study focuses on implementing and evaluating an evidence-based collaborative method of
      increasing immunization rates among preschool children, adolescents and adults within an
      Accountable Care Organization-Public Health collaborative. The infrastructure we will create
      through this project will serve as the framework for future collaborative delivery of other
      preventive services.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accountable Care Organizations/ Public Health Collaborative

detailed_description.textblock:
The current project leverages newly formed Regional Care Collaborative Organizations (RCCO)
      in Colorado that are charged with providing comprehensive care for children and adults
      insured by Medicaid.  With a new RCCO-public health collaborative we will implement a
      randomized controlled trial to test the effectiveness of 1) evidence-based collaborative
      centralized method of increasing immunization delivery using reminder/recall techniques
      versus 2) traditional practice-based reminder/recall techniques that are done by individual
      practices (not centrally). These interventions have been previously developed by the study
      team in different clinical settings.  The project will examine the collaborative centralized
      approach, implemented within the new RCCO-public health collaborative first among preschool
      children, the group in which it has been previously studied.  We will then extend the method
      to new populations, including adolescents and adults within the RCCO, and will evaluate the
      effectiveness of the intervention in each population.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  No subjects will be excluded because of gender, race or ethnicity.

          -  All patients enrolled in Regional Care Collaborative Organizations (RCCOs) study
             practices in the regions covered by Colorado Access, aged 19-35 months, 11-17 years,
             or 18 years and older, who need an immunization according to Advisory Committee on
             Immunization Practices (ACIP) guidelines, will be considered part of the study
             population.

          -  For adults we will also include patients at 8 primary care sites (18 and older) who
             are enrolled in Denver Health.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any child whose parents have requested removal from the immunization registry;

          -  Any adult who has requested removal from the immunization registry;

          -  Any child or adult with hypersensitivity to any component of one of the recommended
             vaccines;

          -  Any child or adult who has moved to a primary care provider other than one at the
             study practices.

intervention.description: Method of increasing immunization delivery using reminder/recall techniques

Comparisons of receipt of any recommended vaccine and all recommended vaccines by study arm
Comparisons of receipt of all needed vaccines
Comparisons of receipt of specific targeted vaccines
